titleInfo.title: Louisiana Civil Rights Movement Oral History Project

name.namePart: Louisiana State University (Baton Rouge, La.). T. Harry Williams Center for Oral History

mods.abstract: Documenting the Civil Rights Movement in Baton Rouge and surrounding parishes.
mods.note: These interviews from the T. Harry Williams Center for Oral History document the Civil Rights Movement in Baton Rouge and the surrounding parishes. Topics include the experience of African Americans during the period of segregation, the Baton Rouge Bus Boycott of 1953, sit-ins in the1960s, Baton Rouge's Biracial Committee, the desegregation of schools and public facilities, voter registration, and the Congress of Racial Equality (CORE) in rural parishes.
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
